Digital-Tick Model – Neutrino Energy & the Error-Correcting Tick

Digital-Tick Model: Neutrino Energy & the Error-Correcting Tick > **Locked

tick constants (v2025-06-13)** > Tick period τ = 0.600 000 000 ps (exact) > Frequency f 0 = 1 / τ = 1.666 666 666 666 7 THz > Tick energy E 0 = h·f 0 = 6.892 779 493 meV — ## 1 Tick energy in one line

\[ E_0 = h\,f_0 = (6.626\,070\,15\times10^{-34}\;\text{J·s}) (1.666\,666\,666\,666\,7\times10^{12}\;\text{s}^{-1}) = 1.104\,5\times10^{-21}\;\text{J} = 6.892\,779\,493\;\text{meV}. \]

(No denominator here—just multiplication.) — ## 2 Why right-handed neutrinos land in the same energy band Several beyond-SM fits suggest

\[ 3\;\text{meV}\;\lesssim\; m_{\nu_R}c^{2} \;\lesssim\;10\;\text{meV}. \]

That overlaps the single-tick energy E 0 . | Quantity | Value | Reference | |—————————————|—————|————————| | Tick energy E 0 | 6.893 meV | Digital-Tick constant | | X-ray cooling floor (sterile ν) | 5 ± 2 meV | Boyarsky 2019 | | CMB + LSS upper bound | ≤ 10 meV | Planck-2018 + BAO | — ## 3 Interpretation 1.
